tags: that girl is about to run westeros
summary: sansa is everything dany wishes  she were don’t @ me l said what l said and l meant what l said !! she is loved by her people...
body:
sansa is everything dany wishes  she were don’t @ me l said what l said and l meant what l said !!

  • she is loved by her people
  • her people want her to be their queen 
  • her people trust her
  • she takes care of her people not because she expects Something in return but because she wants to and thinks it’s her duty to take care of them!!
  • she puts her people need before her own agenda
  • she is smart… l mean she is the queen westeros deserves

blog.name: themoonbrokenbysilence
blog.title: born amongst the wild things
blog.description:
I was trying to describe the kingdom, but the letters
kept smudging as I wrote them: the hunter's heart,
the hunter's mouth, the trees and the trees and the
space between the trees, swimming in gold

summary: The long tail of the great comet visible through the high scuttling clouds. Sansa was watching it from her tower window when Ser...
caption:
The long tail of the great comet visible through the high scuttling clouds. Sansa was watching it from her tower window when Ser Arys Oakheart arrived to escort her down to the tourney grounds. “What do you think it means?” she asked him.

“Glory to your betrothed,” Ser Arys answered at once.[…]  “He is the dragon’s heir “

blog.name: sansadanvers
blog.title: Wolves are supposed to be brave, aren’t they?

summary: So if you've followed my blog for more than a year. you know i love daenerys targaryen. Yes, I love Daenerys if you're new to my...
body: So if you’ve followed my blog for more than a year. you know i love daenerys targaryen. Yes, I love Daenerys if you’re new to my blog, yes i like her. i used to want her on the iron throne and married to jon. and now i’m like; can the dothraki flay her? i think my love for her comes from my love of emilia. but i’m a big sansa fan. i think sansa is mix of anne nevile, cathryn howard, and elizabeth of york. while daenerys is like richard 3 and mary 1. i’ll give examples in a little bit.

summary:
Sansa Stark Week - Day 3 • Favourite Book or Fashion
“Once she had loved Prince Joffrey with all her heart, and admired and...
body:
Sansa Stark Week - Day 3 • Favourite Book or Fashion

“Once she had loved Prince Joffrey with all her heart, and admired and trusted his mother, the queen. They had repaid that love and trust with her father’s head. Sansa would never make that mistake again”

blog.name: thedropletsparkled
blog.title: Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind.
blog.description:
I'm interested in fantasy, fantasy art, A Song of Ice and Fire / Game of Thrones, SanSan, vegan recipes and creative writing.
My main blog with my own fanfiction, drawings and some poems:
http://maracuyakongeen.livejournal.com/
My fanfiction on AO3: http://archiveofourown.org/users/Maracuya/works

Disclaimer: I do not own my works of fanfiction/fanart. I do not profit from the stories or drawings, nor would I ever seek to do so. All credit for characters,plot and settings go to the respective original author or artist.

body:
First Line Game!

RULES: List the first lines of the last ten stories you published. Look to see if there are any patterns that you notice yourself, and see if anyone else notices any! Then tag some friends.

I was tagged by dear @zip00198704 - thanks a lot! Now I must say that I’ve got more than 60 works on AO3, so I simply decided to list up ALL the beginnings of my SanSan multi-chapter fics. Please forgive me, I’ve still got more than 10… *blush*

Here’s the list:

“Go bugger yourself with an iron poker, monk! And take this crap with you!” (‘Eight Weeks’)

Sandor looked up at the ceiling as if he could see through the mortar, the stones, the wooden beams. ('Roots Growing Deep’)

Petyr Moriarty rubbed his hands in glee and applied some mint oil from a bottle-green, diamond-shaped phial after he had shaven his cheeks and had trimmed his goatee. ('The Murder of Prime Minister Jon Arryn’)

Sansa was sitting with her mother and baby Arya on a cart at the head of the travelling party, and the girl looked with round eyes into the world. ('From the Beginning’)

Sansa could feel the cold flagstones through the thin slippers as her feet were hitting the ground at a high frequency. ('BamBOOZled Dog’)

It was a clear, sunny day and nobody had really expected an attack, even less from a professional assassin. ('The Queen of the Fleas’)

Sansa couldn’t get the story out of her head, and she wept into her pillow, long after Sandor Clegane had returned her to her chamber. ('The Poor Man!)

Seven buggering hells – why did they have to head north? ('And suddenly, everything was different’)

Riverlands, autumn / Little Bird, surprised to get a letter? ('A Letter from the Riverlands’)

It was raining. But it wasn’t fire that was pouring from the heavens. No. It was bloody green fire! ('The Day is Dark and Full of Questions’)

Ser Balon Swann came for her in the morning, his polished armour clanking. ('Of pushing puppets together… and of puppets cutting their strings’)

Another bloody year. Another bloody year he had survived against all odds. ('The Nameday Present’)

It was the first day after their arrival in King’s Landing and Lord Eddard Stark, Warden of the North, new Hand of the king was… pissed off. Not even he knew another expression for it.  ('The Pyromancer’s Potion’)

It was a good day for Sansa Lupusina Baratinus. Each day since the death of her husband Primus Iofrecus Baratinus had been a good day, to be precise. ('Cave Canem’)

The voyage had been exhausting, even more so in her state and with all the melting snow turning the roads into mush. Sansa placed a protective hand on her swelling belly. ('Puzzle Pieces’)

Sansa remembered the scene as if it had been yesterday, but it had been three years before. The moment when she had been betrothed to this man. ('Un-wedding with a non-Ser’)

Result: I’m heavy on including people in my first lines - and on swearing/vulgar language, especially if I start a story from Sandor’s PoV.

Thanks for tagging! And if anyone wants to play along - feel free to do so. :-)

tags: he's better than many people in the books but you'd think he was a saint the way the narrative treats him
summary: What frustrates me so much about Ned as a character is that he's portrayed as this ideal hero/father figure by the fandom and...
question: What frustrates me so much about Ned as a character is that he's portrayed as this ideal hero/father figure by the fandom and the narrative, and yet his actions cause lasting consequences, esp for Jon and Sansa. even theon (taking an innocent hostage, who depends on his father's obedience for survival, to every beheading is fucking cold). And we never see these characters reflect on his issues and their effect on them. Was it even GRRM's intention to make Ned so oblivious and negligent?
answer: I don’t even think GRRM realises or cares that Ned’s not that great. There’s some serious glorification in the books. I bet the Theon ‘my real father died in King’s Landing’ scene will show up in WoW which is fucked up. That man was holding him hostage, allowed him to get beaten by household members and without hesitation would have executed him if Balon rebelled. Sansa won’t think about Ned putting her in danger when he took her to KL while investigating the Lannisters. She’ll feel bad about going to Cersei and betraying gallant Ned (who let’s not forget told Cersei everything). Jon won’t think about how Ned was 100% ok with him joining the Night’s Watch because it makes him less of a threat to Robert. He’ll reject Rhaegar to embrace Ned because Ned is that perfect.

reblog.comment: I don’t even think GRRM realises or cares that Ned’s not that great. There’s some serious glorification in the books. I bet the Theon ‘my real father died in King’s Landing’ scene will show up in WoW which is fucked up. That man was holding him hostage, allowed him to get beaten by household members and without hesitation would have executed him if Balon rebelled. Sansa won’t think about Ned putting her in danger when he took her to KL while investigating the Lannisters. She’ll feel bad about going to Cersei and betraying gallant Ned (who let’s not forget told Cersei everything). Jon won’t think about how Ned was 100% ok with him joining the Night’s Watch because it makes him less of a threat to Robert. He’ll reject Rhaegar to embrace Ned because Ned is that perfect.

trail.content_raw: I don’t even think GRRM realises or cares that Ned’s not that great. There’s some serious glorification in the books. I bet the Theon ‘my real father died in King’s Landing’ scene will show up in WoW which is fucked up. That man was holding him hostage, allowed him to get beaten by household members and without hesitation would have executed him if Balon rebelled. Sansa won’t think about Ned putting her in danger when he took her to KL while investigating the Lannisters. She’ll feel bad about going to Cersei and betraying gallant Ned (who let’s not forget told Cersei everything). Jon won’t think about how Ned was 100% ok with him joining the Night’s Watch because it makes him less of a threat to Robert. He’ll reject Rhaegar to embrace Ned because Ned is that perfect.
trail.content: I don’t even think GRRM realises or cares that Ned’s not that great. There’s some serious glorification in the books. I bet the Theon ‘my real father died in King’s Landing’ scene will show up in WoW which is fucked up. That man was holding him hostage, allowed him to get beaten by household members and without hesitation would have executed him if Balon rebelled. Sansa won’t think about Ned putting her in danger when he took her to KL while investigating the Lannisters. She’ll feel bad about going to Cersei and betraying gallant Ned (who let’s not forget told Cersei everything). Jon won’t think about how Ned was 100% ok with him joining the Night’s Watch because it makes him less of a threat to Robert. He’ll reject Rhaegar to embrace Ned because Ned is that perfect.

blog.name: 0pheliaraine
blog.title: Ophelia Raine
blog.description: I write (primarily) Game of Thrones fan fiction including Petyr x Sansa, Tywin x Marge, Stannis x Sansa, Tywin x Sansa, among others.

summary: Chapter 4 of HYSTERICAL “This here,” Petyr explains now, his expression once again unreadable, “is Dorne’s biggest and greatest...
caption:
Chapter 4 of HYSTERICAL

“This here,” Petyr explains now, his expression once again unreadable, “is Dorne’s biggest and greatest seller. The Dornish Sand Steed in mechanical form. Manufactured by the Martell family, Vigor — for that is a most evocative name for a mechanical steed, is it not? — comes with a selection of special saddles to suit the rider. Its one glaring fault? It gives every promise of moving independent to its rider, but it does not; the different paces are powered by the rider’s own exertions.”

“Oh!” Sansa exclaims at the last, and tries valiantly not to make manifest her private disappointment.

“Indeed,” smirks Petyr, “it is but a child’s rocking horse affixed with a leather dildoe that masquerades poorly as a pommel installed by the blind —if you will pardon the crassness of plain speech, m’lady.”

>>> READ CHAPTER 4

tags: also my favourite book is AFFC if i went that route
summary: Sansa Week // DAY THREE: Favorite Season/ Favorite Book or Fashion  I may have misunderstood the assignment and have not focused...
caption:
Sansa Week // DAY THREE: Favorite Season/ Favorite Book or Fashion

I may have misunderstood the assignment and have not focused on an actual fashion Sansa has worn, instead drawing a whole bunch of looks she most certainly should have. 

A little turquoise number for sitting in the gardens, an Alayne looks, bastard but make it fashion, a casual running her castle organising a feast look, a jewel green and red dress with the black bodice to be eye catching at said dinner, then full blown GOWN bitch with the pink and the gold and the dramatic sleeves, we live, and then finally a sweet little pink dress for when she’s feeling flirty under the sun, winters coming? not this moment honey.
